detaileddescription.para: The object who implements the method for drawing the data. In Desmo-J this is the HistogramPlotter respectively the TimeSeriesPlotter.
The legend (labeling) of the y axis.
The legend (labeling) of the x axis.
The minimum x value of the data set (needed for scaling).
The maximum x value of the data set (needed for scaling).
The minimum y value of the data set (needed for scaling).
The maximum y value of the data set (needed for scaling).
Largest value which is labeled on the y axis.
Smallest value which is labeled on the y axis.
The interval between two labels on the y axis.
The number of pixels which represents interval_y.
Largest value which is labeled on the x axis.
Smallest value which is labeled on the x axis.
The interval between two labels on the x axis.
The number of pixels which represents interval_x.
The size of the font used for labeling.
The font used for labeling.
The thickness of arrows on axes.
The left border of the white space for drawing the chart. This is not 0, because in the left of the chart there are for example the labels of the y axis.
The right border of the white space for drawing the chart. This is not equal to the width of the canvas, because in the right of the chart there is a small spacing.
The upper border of the white space for drawing the chart. This is not 0, because above the chart there is a small spacing.
The right border of the white space for drawing the chart. This is not equal to the width of the canvas, because under the chart there are for example the labels of the x axis.
The minimum spacing between two labels on the axes.
The border spacing of the chart.

Constructor of the chart. Saves the given labels for x- and y-axis and calls the constructor of java.awt.Canvas
chartOwner
The object which implements the drawChart() method.
x_label
The legend for the x axis.
y_label
The legend for the y axis.

This method is called automatically if the canvas has to be repaint. You don`t have to do this! It overrides the paint(Graphics) method from java.awt.Canvas. If size of the chart is big enough, it calls paintBackground() (for painting the chart background).
g
The specified Graphics context.
Draws the chart basics. Calculates the best fitting intervalls for the axes. Paints a white backgorund, the axes, the labels and a grey grid for easier metering.

At last it tansforms (not scales!) the coordinate system. Thus the methods drawLine, drawRect and fillRect must not take care about transforming: The root of the coordinate system will be (0,0), and the value y will be autoscaled to -y, so a higher data value will be painted above a lower y value, unlike the coordinate system of a canvas. ATTENTION: The value "1" still represents a pixel, because if we would scale "1" to interval_x (or rather interval_y) a new line would be very fat (that is not want we want). The "scaling" will be done by the methods calculateXPosition() and calculateYPosition() of this class, which will be automatically invoked if you use drawLine(), drawRect() or fillRect().
g
The specified Graphics context.

Calculates the x coordinate in pixels for the given x data value.
x
The x data value.
The x position in pixels, where the data value should be painted.

Calculates the y coordinate in pixels for the given y data value.
y
The y data value.
The y position in pixels, where the data value should be painted.

memberdef.argsstring: (Graphics g, double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2)
memberdef.name: drawLine

detaileddescription.para:
Draws a line into the chart. This method automatically calls the methods calculateXPosition() and calculateYPosition() so you don`t have to take care about any scaling or transforming.
g
The specified Graphics context.
x1
The x value of the starting coordinates.
y1
The y value of the starting coordinates.
x2
The x value of the ending coordinates.
y2
The x value of the ending coordinates.

The specified Graphics context.
x1
The x value of the starting coordinates.
y1
The y value of the starting coordinates.
x2
The x value of the ending coordinates.
y2
The x value of the ending coordinates.

The specified Graphics context.
x1
The x value of the starting coordinates.
y1

memberdef.argsstring: (Color color, double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2)
memberdef.name: drawLine

detaileddescription.para: Draws a line into the chart. This method automatically calls the methods calculateXPosition() and calculateYPosition() so you don`t have to take care about any scaling or transforming.

If you have a graphic context (e.g. method shall be invoked via a paint(Graphics g) method you should NOT use this method, but rather drawLine(Graphics, double, double, double, double).
color
The color of the line.
x1
The x value of the starting coordinates.
y1
The y value of the starting coordinates.
x2
The x value of the ending coordinates.
y2
The x value of the ending coordinates.

Tests a new pair of values which appears in the data. The pair will NOT be stored, it only will be tested if the values are lower or higher than the existing minimums and maximums. This is needed for scaling the chart automatically.
x
A new x value which shall be tested, if it is the new minmum or maximum.
y
A new y value which shall be tested, if it is the new minmum or maximum.
Returns true if the values are higher or smaller than the current axis borders.

Sets the maximum y value which appears in the data.
max_y
The maximum y value which appears in the data.

Sets the maximum x value which appears in the data.
max_x
The maximum x value which appears in the data.

Sets the minimum x value which appears in the data.
min_x
The minimum x value which appears in the data.

Sets the minimum y value which appears in the data.
min_y
The minimum y value which appears in the data.

Resets the legend (labeling) for the x axis.
x_label
A new title for the x axis.

Resets the legend (labeling) for the y axis.
y_label
A new title for the y axis.
Event handler for right-mouse-clicks onto the chart. The context menu will be shown.
Event handler for this class. Does nothing.

memberdef.argsstring: (Graphics2D g2d, FontRenderContext fdr, String text, float x, float y)
memberdef.name: drawVerticalString

detaileddescription.para:
Draws a text which is rotated by 90 degrees.
g2d
The specified Graphics context.
fdr
The specified FontRenderContext.
text
The text which shall be displayed.
x
The x coordinate of the right(!) border.
y
The y coordinate of the bottom border.

Sets a new font size for the font used inside the chart (e.g. for labels).
g
The specified Graphics context.
size
The new Size for the the font.

A GUI component (inherited from java.awt.Canvas) which displays a chart. It includes two labeled and auto-scaled axes. There a methods (drawLine, drawRect, fillRect) to paint on the chart without taking care about transforming or scaling the dimensions. You have to add this class to a panel or a frame. You also have to implement the method which should draw the data (e.g. a histogram or a mathematical function) in a class which is inherited from the interface ChartOwner.
